extendedIngredients.name: blue cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 3 ounces blue cheese cut into small pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: blue cheese cut into small pieces

extendedIngredients.name: pears
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pears (such as Bosc or Bartlett), each cored and sliced into 8 wedges
extendedIngredients.originalName: pears (such as Bosc or Bartlett), each cored and sliced into 8 wedges

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 6 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced prosciutto cut in half lengthwise

title: Pears with Blue Cheese and Prosciutto
summary: The recipe Pears with Blue Cheese and Prosciutto could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in about 45 minutes. Watching your figure? This gluten free and primal recipe has 152 calories, 5g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. For $1.09 per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. Only a few people really liked this side dish. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. If you have arugula, prosciutto, lemon juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 14%. This score is rather bad. Try Roasted Pears with Goat Cheese and Prosciutto, Apple Chutney & Prosciutto Melt with Gruyere Cheese and Pears, and Greens with Pears and Blue Cheese for similar recipes.
instructions: Roll up an arugula leaf, a piece of pear, and a piece of cheese in the prosciutto.

steps.step: Roll up an arugula leaf, a piece of pear, and a piece of cheese in the prosciutto.
